app.name: Youth Development Initiative
app.tagline: A municipality- and grant-ready youth development system for ages 7–20.

common.currentLanguageAria: Current language: {{languageName}}. Click to change language.

home.heroSubtitle: Operational system for scheduling, attendance, volunteers, governance, and reporting.
home.joinCommunitySubtitle: Whether you're a young person seeking growth, a parent looking for support, or someone who wants to contribute, there's a place for you here.
home.volunteerDesc: Share your skills and time to make a difference
home.mentorDesc: Guide and inspire the next generation
home.partnerDesc: Collaborate as a school, club, or organization
home.missionTitle: Built on Trust, Committed to Excellence
home.missionBody: Operating under the Made By Young Hands youth development model, we connect schools, sports clubs, families, and community partners into a unified system that tracks development, participation, and long-term outcomes.
home.missionStandards: Our platform meets the rigorous standards reviewed by municipalities, Vinnova, schools, sports federations, corporate sponsors, and NGOs across Sweden.
home.programsSubtitle: Comprehensive pathways designed to support every aspect of youth development, from academic achievement to personal growth.

missionPillars.safeguardingDesc: Zero-tolerance safeguarding with clear reporting and strong standards for all adults.
missionPillars.dataProtectionDesc: GDPR-first data handling, retention policies, and user rights built in.
missionPillars.financialDesc: Transparent reporting, audit practices, and exportable documentation for partners.
missionPillars.ethicalDesc: Clear governance practices, conflict management, and accountability standards.

about.title: About
about.missionBody:
We develop young people through structured, safeguarded pathways that combine education support, girls' sports retention (with a strong focus on football), creative skills development, and mentorship.

Operating under the Made By Young Hands youth development model, we connect schools, sports clubs, families, and community partners into a unified system that tracks participation, personal development, and long-term outcomes, with specific emphasis on social inclusion for youth from foreign-background and under-resourced communities.

Our platform is designed to meet governance, safeguarding, and transparency standards reviewed by municipalities, VGFF/SVFF, Vinnova, schools, corporate sponsors, and youth development organizations across Sweden.

values.youthFirstDesc: Every decision we make prioritizes the wellbeing, development, and future of the young people we serve.
values.inclusiveDesc: We create safe, ambitious environments for girls and boys, including youth from foreign-background and under-resourced communities.
values.communityDesc: We connect schools, clubs, families, municipalities, and sponsors into one coordinated support system.
values.impactDesc: We track participation, attendance, and progress so partners can see outcomes and long-term value.

programs.title: Our Programs
programs.subtitle: Our programs are designed as connected pathways. Participants can join at any stage and progress over time.
programs.socialIntegrationTitle: Social Integration & Belonging Through Sport & Creativity
programs.socialIntegrationSubtitle: (Youth with Foreign Background / New in Sweden)
programs.socialIntegrationDescription: This program supports young people from migrant, refugee, and foreign-background families by using sports and creative work as tools for integration, language development, and social belonging.
programs.creativeSkillsDescription: Workshops that build confidence, collaboration, and practical skills. These sessions complement sport and education pathways.
programs.schoolSupportDescription: Homework support, study planning, and structured guidance for ages 7–15. Sessions are designed to complement school routines and help participants build consistent habits.
programs.footballDescription: Training pathways for boys and girls across ages 7–20 with a strong focus on long-term retention, confidence, and healthy performance culture.
programs.mentorshipDescription: Mentor circles and guidance sessions for ages 15–20, focused on goals, education pathways, leadership, and safe decision-making.

activities.title: Activities Calendar
activities.subtitle: Training and development sessions across Trollhättan and Vänersborg (including Sjuntorp, Vargön, Bråland and Mellerud), with planned growth toward Uddevalla, Grästorp and across Västra Götaland.
activities.setupHint: Make sure your Supabase project is configured and the schema in supabase/schema.sql has been applied.
activities.missingEnvBody: Add VITE_SUPABASE_URL and VITE_SUPABASE_PUBLISHABLE_KEY to your .env file and restart the dev server.
activities.emptyBody: Sign in as an admin to add activities, or load sample data to get started.
activities.safeguardingGateTitle: Acknowledge the safeguarding policy to RSVP
activities.safeguardingGateBody: To protect children and youth, a digital safeguarding acknowledgement is required before RSVP/attendance actions are allowed.

seedTitles.intensiveFootballRotating: Intensive Football Skills Development (Boys & Girls 15–20) – Rotating venue

auth.title: Sign In
auth.staffNote: Staff accounts are controlled by admins. Use an invite code to register.

admin.title: Admin Dashboard
admin.subtitle: Exports and compliance oversight (safeguarding acknowledgements, RSVP non-responders).

invites.redeemHint2: and choose Sign up with invite code.
invites.activeListHelp: This list does not reveal the invite code itself (only admin-created metadata). Generate a new code if needed.
invites.auditHelp: Immutable record of staff invite usage. This supports governance audits and sponsor/municipality review.

admin.locationHint: Leave blank to match all locations for this program type.
admin.shareSecurely: Share the code securely with the intended recipient.

ack.title: Export acknowledgements
ack.description: This list is generated from signed digital acknowledgements stored in the backend.

attendance.title: RSVP compliance report
attendance.showingFirst15: Showing first 15. Export PDF for full list.
attendance.remindersHelp: The system supports scheduled RSVP reminder emails via a Vercel Cron job calling
attendance.remindersHelp2: Configure email provider environment variables to enable real delivery.

admin.enrollmentsHelp: Enrollments define who is expected to RSVP for each activity. The RSVP compliance report and reminder automation only targets participants who have an active enrollment matching the activity’s program type (and optional location).
admin.enrollmentSavedBody: The participant is now included in RSVP compliance for this program type.
admin.invitesHelp: Invite codes enable controlled staff signup for volunteers, workers/coaches, and board members. Codes can expire and can be limited to a number of uses.

staff.title: Staff Portal
staff.subtitle: Tools for volunteers, staff, and board members: activities, participants, and reporting.

activities.title: Activities
activities.description: View the weekly/monthly schedule, venues, and session details. Use this to prepare staffing and follow-up.

governance.title: Governance & Safeguarding
governance.description: Review safeguarding, data protection, and governance documents. Staff are expected to follow these policies.

admin.title: Admin
admin.description: Administration tools for compliance exports, staff invites, and enrollment management.

contact.title: Contact
contact.subtitle: Whether you're a parent, potential volunteer, partner organization, or sponsor, we'd love to hear from you. Reach out and let's discuss how we can work together.
contact.responseTimeValue: We aim to respond within 48 hours
contact.sendMessageDesc: Fill out the form below and we'll get back to you shortly.
contact.subject: Subject

toast.successBody: We'll get back to you as soon as possible.
toast.errorBody: Please try again in a moment.

placeholders.subject: How can we help?
placeholders.message: Tell us more about your inquiry...

footer.madeWithPassion: Made with passion for youth development in Sweden

whatWeDo.3: Guidance for parents/guardians on routines and follow-up

howItConnects.1: Attendance tracking aligned with safeguarding and data protection
howItConnects.2: Mentor feedback integrated into participant progress profiles
howItConnects.3: Exportable summaries for school collaboration (when consent applies)

weeklyTraining.1: Age-group sessions in Trollhättan and Vänersborg (including Sjuntorp and Vargön)
weeklyTraining.2: Separate sessions for boys and girls where appropriate
weeklyTraining.3: Attendance and RSVP rules (48h response window) supported by the platform

intensiveTraining.2: Individual technical/tactical focus with feedback logs
intensiveTraining.3: Suitable for participants aiming for higher competitive levels

mentorCircles.1: Regular small-group sessions with consistent mentor teams
mentorCircles.2: Clear safeguarding standards and reporting procedures

volunteerCoordination.1: Volunteers can register and book availability
volunteerCoordination.2: Admins can confirm assignments and export coverage summaries
volunteerCoordination.3: Digital policy acknowledgements (safeguarding and data protection)

workshops.1: Creative workshops (media, arts, and project-based learning)
workshops.2: Safe and inclusive environment with clear conduct expectations
workshops.3: Age-adapted sessions for 8–14 and mixed groups

outcomes.3: Exportable summaries for partners when consent applies)

socialIntegration.fundableBody: The approach strengthens protective factors such as consistent adult support, peer belonging, and structured routines, while building bridges between families, schools, clubs, and local communities.

outcomesMeasured.1: Participation consistency and retention over time.
outcomesMeasured.2: Increased social belonging and peer connection.
outcomesMeasured.3: Improved Swedish language confidence in practical settings.
outcomesMeasured.4: Family engagement and support network strength.

socialIntegration.whoForBody: Young people ages 7–20 in Trollhättan and Vänersborg with a focus on youth who are new in Sweden, or from under-resourced communities seeking safe, structured pathways into sport, creativity, and mentorship.

safeguarding.lead: The safety and wellbeing of every young person in our programs is our highest priority. This policy outlines our commitment to creating a safe environment for all participants.

zeroTolerance.title: Zero Tolerance
zeroTolerance.desc: We maintain zero tolerance for abuse, neglect, exploitation, or harassment of any kind.

backgroundChecks.title: Background Checks
backgroundChecks.desc: All staff, volunteers, and coaches undergo mandatory background checks before working with children.

codeOfConduct.title: Code of Conduct
codeOfConduct.desc: Clear behavioral standards for all adults interacting with young people in our programs.

reporting.title: Reporting Procedures
reporting.desc: Confidential and accessible channels for reporting any safeguarding concerns.

safeguarding.commitmentBody: 07–20 Youth Development Initiative is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people. We expect all staff, volunteers, coaches, and partner organizations to share this commitment.

principles.1: The welfare of children is paramount in all our work
principles.2: All children have the right to protection from abuse and exploitation
principles.4: We work in partnership with families and communities
principles.5: We maintain transparent and accountable practices

safeguarding.reportingBody: If you have any safeguarding concerns, please contact our designated safeguarding lead immediately. All reports are handled confidentially and in accordance with Swedish law and best practices.
safeguarding.contactNote: All staff and volunteers are required to acknowledge this policy upon joining.
safeguarding.ackBody: All staff and volunteers must digitally acknowledge and sign this policy upon account creation. Signed acknowledgements are exportable as PDF for compliance documentation.

dataProtection.lead: We are committed to GDPR-compliant data protection. This page explains what we collect, how we use it, and your rights.

collect.title: What We Collect
collect.desc: Personal information necessary for program participation, including names, contact details, and development records.

use.title: How We Use It
use.desc: Data is used solely for program delivery, progress tracking, and reporting to stakeholders with proper consent.

retention.title: Data Retention
retention.desc: We retain data only as long as necessary for the purposes described, with clear retention policies and deletion routines.

rights.title: Your Rights
rights.desc: You can access, correct, export, or delete your personal data, and withdraw consent at any time.

dataProtection.consentBody: All registration forms include GDPR consent checkboxes. Consent can be withdrawn at any time through your account settings or by contacting our Data Protection Officer.
dataProtection.exerciseBody: For data protection inquiries or to exercise your rights:
dataProtection.dpoBody: Contact our DPO for data protection inquiries.
dataProtection.accountToolsBody: Registered users can manage their data directly through their account dashboard. The following options are available:
dataProtection.note: Note: Sign in required to access these features. Requests are processed within 30 days.

financial.lead: We are committed to complete transparency in how we receive and allocate funds. Our financial practices meet the standards required by municipalities, Vinnova, and other stakeholders.

bodies.fundingSources: We document where funding comes from (municipalities, grants, partners) and publish summaries for stakeholders.
bodies.fundAllocation: We track and report how funds are allocated across programs, staffing, safeguarding, and operations.
bodies.auditPolicy: Our accounts are reviewed annually by an independent auditor. Audit reports can be requested by stakeholders.
bodies.antiFraud: We apply controls to prevent misuse, including approval workflows and transparent recordkeeping.

financial.reportsBody: Our accounts are reviewed annually by an independent auditor. Audit reports are made available to stakeholders and can be requested through our contact form.

coi.lead: Maintaining ethical standards and impartiality in all our operations. This policy ensures transparency and accountability in decision-making processes.

sections.disclosureBody: All board members, staff, and key partners are required to disclose any actual, potential, or perceived conflicts of interest upon joining and whenever a new conflict arises.
sections.recusalBody: When a conflict is identified, the person must step back from related decisions and discussions.
sections.internalProcessBody: Staff and board members can submit conflict of interest disclosures through the internal portal. All submissions are reviewed by an admin-only review panel.
sections.transparencyBody: We maintain a register of declared conflicts. Summary information is included in our annual governance report.

coi.proceduresTitle: When a conflict of interest is identified

procedures.1: Declare the conflict as soon as it is identified.
procedures.2: Record the disclosure in the conflict register.
procedures.3: Recuse from decisions where the conflict applies.
procedures.4: Review and confirm compliance during audits.

team.title: Team
team.intro: Meet the people behind 07–20 — our founder, board, and volunteers working together to build safe, structured pathways for young people.
team.founderPageIntro: A short introduction for the Founder page. Use this text to explain why 07–20 was founded and what the founder focuses on.
team.boardPageIntro: A short introduction for the Board page. Use this text to explain governance, accountability, and oversight responsibilities.
team.volunteersPageIntro: A short introduction for the Volunteers page. Use this text to explain the volunteer roles and why volunteers are essential to safe delivery.
team.storyBody:
07–20 was created to give young people a safe, ambitious environment where education support, sport, creativity, and mentorship connect into one pathway.

We focus on consistency, safeguarding, and measurable progress, so families, schools, and partners can trust the system.

founder.name: Paul Abejegah
founder.body:
Paul founded 07–20 to build a structured youth development system combining football, education support, and mentorship.

His work focuses on long-term retention, safeguarding, and creating environments where young people develop confidence, discipline, and healthy ambition.

team.sharedValuesBody: We lead with safeguarding, consistency, and accountability. We build supportive relationships, set clear expectations, and track progress so every young person can grow.

idris.name: Idris Ajriaj
idris.body: Supports governance and program integrity, with a focus on fair play, rules knowledge, and safe environments.

goran.name: Göran Andersson
goran.body: Supports mentoring culture, routines, and practical structure that helps young people stay consistent over time.

abdinasir.name: Ali Omar
abdinasir.body: Contributes to development planning, analysis, and helping young people progress through clear, measurable steps.

openSlot1.name: Open Board Seat
openSlot1.body: We are currently recruiting an additional board member with experience in youth development, safeguarding, education, or finance.

openSlot2.name: Open Board Seat
openSlot2.body: We are currently recruiting an additional board member with experience in community partnerships, governance, or fundraising.

volunteers.title: Volunteers
volunteers.intro: Volunteers are the backbone of delivery, coaches, mentors, event support, and trusted adults who help run sessions safely.

items.coachesBody: Support training sessions, learning routines, and positive performance culture.
items.mentorsBody: Provide guidance, consistency, and role-model support for ages 15–20.
items.supportBody: Help with logistics, attendance flow, communication, and welcoming families.
items.eventsBody: Assist with workshops, partner events, community days, and coordination.

volunteers.ctaBody: If you want to contribute as a coach, mentor, or support volunteer, contact us and we’ll guide you through safeguarding and onboarding.
